Issues.Title: Don't make `track` keyword mandatory in `for` statements
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

`17.0.0-rc.0`

### Description

I understand that the `track` keyword is useful for performance reasons, and was using angular from the 1.x days where `track by` could make a big difference in heavy loops. It saved me in a couple of components at the time which without it would have been major UX problems so I totally understand its purpose and benefits.

However I don't think it should be mandatory, because:

- the most common use case has no performance implications, but the developer would still have to specify the tracking property
- is unable to fully align with JS convention, where `for...of` doesn't have such a `track` property
- it's simple to assume that if no `track` is specified, then the item being iterated is what is being tracked, no need to explicitly say it each time
- Allow for when it IS being explicitly defined, it's defining a performance-sensitive part of the code which should be treated with extra caution, which allows for a semantically richer template

I could go on, but you see where I'm coming from.

Thoughts?

### Proposed solution

Make it optional, or perhaps if a loop takes longer than x time to run per item, suggest to use track in a warning (which can be disabled if the developer desires... I don't know)

### Alternatives considered

n/a
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Don't make `track` keyword mandatory in `for` statements" (#52316)

Issues.Title: update CSP documentation to avoid breaking animations and ngStyle
Issues.Body:
As reported in #51365, despite the nonce attribute on style elements, style attributes used by https://angular.io/api/common/NgStyle and https://angular.io/api/animations/style that were allowed by 'unsafe-inline' are now blocked. 

Adding `style-src-attr 'unsafe-inline';` to the CSP header avoid blocking these style attributes.

Considering that [style-src-attr](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/style-src-attr#browser_compatibility) isn't supported by Safari yet, it should maybe be documented that using a nonce and `style-src-attr 'unsafe-inline';` will break animations on some browsers, and that wide browser support can only be achieved with the previously documented `style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline';`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "update CSP documentation to avoid breaking animations and ngStyle" (#52310)

Issues.Title: perf(core): Update LView consumer to only mark component for check
Issues.Body:
This commit updates the reactive template and host binding consumers to only mark their declaration components for refresh, but not parents/ancestors.

This also updates the `AfterViewChecked` hook to run when a component is refreshed during change detection but its host is not. It is reasonable to expect that the `ngAfterViewChecked` lifecycle hook will run when a signal updates and the component is refreshed. The hooks are typically run when the host is refreshed so without this change, the update to not mark ancestors dirty would have caused `ngAfterViewChecked` to not run.

resolves #14628
resolves #22646

resolves #34347 - this is not the direct request of the issue but generally forcing change detection to run is necessary only because a value was updated that needs to be synced to the DOM. Values that use signals will mark the component for check automatically so accessing the `ChangeDetectorRef` of a child is not necessary. The other part of this request was to avoid the need to "mark all views for checking since it wouldn't affect anything but itself". This is directly addressed by this PR - updating a signal that's read in the child view's template will not cause ancestors/"all views" to be refreshed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): Update LView consumer to only mark component for check" (#52302)

Issues.Title: perf(core): avoid unnecessary callbacks in after render hooks
Issues.Body:
A few performance improvements and code cleanups in the after render hooks:
1. We were wrapping each `destroy` callback in another callback, because `destroy` was typed as `|undefined`. This is unnecessary, because the callback is guaranteed to exist. These changes pass the `destroy` function around directly and avoid the additional callback.
2. In server platforms we were recreating a noop `AfterRenderRef` on each invocation. We can save some memory by returning the same one.
3. Reworks the `AfterRenderCallback` so that it injects `NgZone` and `ErrorHandler` itself, instead of expecting them to be passed in. This reduces the amount of repetition in the code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): avoid unnecessary callbacks in after render hooks" (#52292)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): defer triggers cleanup
Issues.Body:
**Note: this PR is in "work in progress" mode, it needs extra tests to verify that cleanup works correctly for all triggers.**

This commit adds the logic to cleanup all triggers once defer block is triggered.

When a trigger is created, its cleanup function is registerd with a new internal service (called `DeferCleanupManager`).

For prefetch triggers we use TDetails as a key, because the process of loading dependencies affects all instances. For regular triggers we use LDetails as a key, since they are instance-specific.

Issues.Title: Sub-optimal optimizations with ESBuild
Issues.Body:
### Command

build


### Description

I've written a demo App which is mostly this: 

```
export class AppComponent {
  constructor() {
    isDevMode() ? console.log('devMode') : console.log('prodMode');
  }
}
```

With Webpack, the first `console.log` is stripped out by optimization on `build` but with esbuild it isn't. 

Just for the sake of testing, I did try to  set `optimization: false` and then using the online REPL pass it through esbuild (just setting  `define: { ngDevMode: 'false'})`& terser : the 1st `console.log` is correctly removed. 

Are we missing some optimization here ? Or is that usecase far too simple to be relevant ?

Issues.Title: `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser-esbuild` reloads when navigating to lazy routes for the first time, causing navigation to fail.
Issues.Body:
### Command serve ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Similar issue: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/25455 When serving with the Vite dev server, with caching enabled but no existing cache for lazy routes, the page will reload when I click on a link to a lazy route. And in some cases, the navigation will simply fail. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/26806995/63dafb60-555e-4922-a808-fbab0a694420 My lazy route shows a list of items in my little test case, and I am using `ngFor` in the template. The navigation will proceed if the template is a simple `

lazy-list works!

`. Despite the reply in the related issue (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/25455), I still expect/hope Angular cache and Vite play more nicely together because I want the cache enabled for faster dev builds. A _very very_ naive idea is that the Vite dev server only reads the cache when it first launches, only writes to the cache before it shuts down, and keeps behaving as if there is no such thing as a cache during the whole life cycle of its process. ### Minimal Reproduction I have [a minimal repo](https://github.com/HymanZHAN/esbuild-issue) with the reproduction. ### Exception or Error _No response_ ### Your Environment ```text > ng version _ _ ____ _ ___ / \ _ __ __ _ _ _| | __ _ _ __ / ___| | |_ _| / â–³ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__| | | | | | | / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | | | |___| |___ | | /_/ \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_| \____|_____|___| |___/ Angular CLI: 16.2.7 Node: 18.12.1 Package Manager: pnpm 7.25.1 OS: linux x64 Angular: 16.2.10 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1602.7 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.2.7 @angular-devkit/core 16.2.7 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.2.7 @angular/cli 16.2.7 @schematics/angular 16.2.7 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.1.6 zone.js 0.13.3 ``` ### Anything else relevant? _No response_

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): conditionally add Angular compiler plugin to polyfills bundling
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based builders (`application`/`browser-esbuild`), the Angular compiler plugin is now only added to the polyfills bundler configuration if TypeScript files are found in the `polyfills` build option. This is not the case for a default project. The Angular compiler plugin is used to provide type-checking diagnostics for any TypeScript files present within the build. However, if there are no TypeScript files to process, there is no need to use it for the polyfills processing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): conditionally add Angular compiler plugin to polyfills bundling" (#26084)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): remove the need to specify `--migrate-only` when `--name` is used during `ng update`
Issues.Body:
This commit updates the behaviour of `ng update --migrate-only` to remove the need for `--migrate-only` option to be specified. `--migrate-only` will be set internally.

Before
```
ng update @angular/cli --migrate-only --name=migration-name
```

Now
```
ng update @angular/cli --name=migration-name
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): remove the need to specify `--migrate-only` when `--name` is used during `ng update`" (#26082)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): isolate typescript usage to compilation worker thread in application builder
Issues.Body: To improve initialization type for the application builder, loading of the typescript package as been removed from the main thread. The parallel TS/NG compilation will instead load typescript during its worker thread startup. The typescript package is currently large and can take several hundred milliseconds to load.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): isolate typescript usage to compilation worker thread in application builder" (#26070)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): workaround for piscina worker destroy recreation
Issues.Body: When destroying a `piscina` package worker pool, the minimum workers must be set to 0 first to prevent the recreation of the minimum number of workers. These workers would then be cleaned up once the worker pool goes out of scope but the recreation and initialization of each worker is unneeded processing that should be avoided.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): workaround for piscina worker destroy recreation" (#26073)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reuse esbuild generated output file hashes
Issues.Body: The development server used with the esbuild-based builders (`application`/`browser-esbuild`) will now use the recently introduced hash values provided by esbuild in its output files. This removes the need for each file to be hashed and analyzed on each rebuild during the development server update analysis.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reuse esbuild generated output file hashes" (#26075)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use component style load result caching information for file watching
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based builders (`application`/`browser-esbuild`) in watch mode including `ng serve`, component stylesheets that used Sass and imported other stylesheets were previously no properly tracked. As a result, changes to the imported stylesheets would not invalidate the component and the rebuild would not contain the updated styles. The files used by the Sass (and Less) stylesheet processing are now correctly tracked in these cases.

Issues.Title: browserslist setting do not work for build
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

In create a simple example in angualr16. I add .browserslistrc config
and follow is my setting:
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/148531536/64ddee00-77cc-417d-881c-14f4e44d217c)
here is my tsconfig setting
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/148531536/68b54137-1e9e-4d33-9533-cca7613280f2)

And I add a piece of code about array.at which is ES2022 new feature.
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/148531536/c7954058-77b3-485a-a49e-bd03d8faf2b2)

when I run ng build, the es target will be changed according to the browser list, babel will be trigger to low-level the code to support chrome 85

The output of JavaScript cannot run on the chrome 85 because "at" function is not define in the array, it seem the down-level did not work

babel is inside the angular cli, will it be called when i run ng build or my understand is wrong?
I just wish it could create a JavaScript output which can run on the chrome 85, even if i use new feature in ES 2022.



### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create a hello world project with angular 16
2. add .browserslistrc config with chrome 85
3. add a piece of code: const array = [1, 2, 3];  array.at(2);
4. execute ng build and deploy the web
5. using chrome 85 to visit it
6. chrome report error: array.at is not define(the browserslistrc  is not work)

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular 16
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "browserslist setting do not work for build" (#26080)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): cache polyfills virtual module result
Issues.Body: This commit adds caching to the polyfills virtual modules to avoid module resolutions on rebuilds which can take up to 3 seconds in some cases. Whilst these are done async, these can still slow down the build slightly due to IO limits.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "     perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): cache polyfills virtual module result" (#26066)

Issues.Title: build: fix build in main branch
Issues.Body: Multiple PRs caused changed in logic which causes TypeScript TypeChecking to fail
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix build in main branch" (#26079)

Issues.Title: angular 17 rc initial project with SSR throw NG04002
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

platform-server

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

when you generate a new project, without changing a single file it will throw this NG04002 error in production
steps to reproduce
```
npx @angular/cli@next new ng-rc-0
cd ng-rc-0
ng b
node .\dist\ng-rc-0\server\server.mjs
```
and open localhost:4000

https://github.com/robertIsaac/ng-rc-0

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): update `ssr` option definition
Issues.Body:
This commits updates the `ssr` application builder option definition. The main change is that now the option does not accept the entry-point as a value. Instead it should be passed in the `entry` suboption.

Example
```json
"ssr": {
    "entry": "server.ts"
}
```

This change in this option is important to allow us in the future to add additional sub options. Like potentially a `platform` or `target`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): update `ssr` option definition" (#26064)

Issues.Title: fix(material/schematics): Create a schematic to add the base theme dimension
Issues.Body:
As of v17, users need to include the new "base" theme dimension for the components they use. For users that are using the "theme" mixins now, the base dimension will be pulled in automatically. However, for users using the "color", "typography", and "density" mixins only, they will need to include the "base" mixin as well.

This schematic works by scanning all of the app's Sass to determine which components had their "color", "typography", or "density" mixins included, but did *not* have their "theme" mixin included. It then locates all of the calls to "mat.core()" and inserts calls to the "base" mixins for the identified compoennts, immediately following. It makes sense to use "mat.core()" as a signal for when to insert them, because the "base" mixins should be used once-per-app, like "mat.core()". We can't guarantee that a "$theme" will be available at the insertion point, so we create a "$dummy-theme" to pass to the base mixins.

We also insert a comment above the new mixins explaining why they were added and a TODO to clean up the "$dummy-theme". Once we have the documentation updated to cover the base dimension, we should follow-up by linking to it from the inserted comment.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/schematics): Create a schematic to add the base theme dimension" (#27964)

Issues.Title: bug(MatFormField): getConnectedOverlayOrigin includes form field hint area
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v14 (works w/ Legacy)

### Description

When migrating to the MDC-based components, the `getConnectedOverlayOrigin()` method on `MatFormField` now seems to point to the bottom of entire form field div (i.e. including the hint area) rather than the bottom edge of the input box. This makes it difficult to attach overlays to the bottom of custom form fields in a clean non-hacky way.

Basic example that demonstrates the problem:

1. Create a basic component that implements `MatFormFieldControl` (just directly copying the example [from the guide here](https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control) works for this).
2. Add a simple `mat-autocomplete` and wire it up to the input on the component.
3. Add a `MatAutocompleteOrigin` field to the component which points to the `MatFormField`'s `getConnectedOverlayOrigin()` (also may need to update this on ngOnInit to be safe).
4. Set the `matAutocompleteConnectedTo` in the template to the `MatAutocompleteOrigin` field.

Previously this would make the autocomplete overlay open lined up below the bottom edge of the form field, now there is an unsightly gap.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/6vnpqz

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click the form field

### Expected Behavior

Attached overlay should appear directly below the form field's underline

### Actual Behavior

Attached overlay appears below the form field's hint area

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.1
- CDK/Material: 16.2.9
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatFormField): getConnectedOverlayOrigin includes form field hint area" (#27967)

Issues.Title: feat(inputs): Add `[readonly]` property to input components
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Right now input components (checkbox, chips, datepicker, form field, radio button, select, slider) have `[disabled]` property. Only `matInput` directive has `[readonly]`.

`[disabled]` property conflicts with the `[formControl]` directive, which has a [property with the same name](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/forms/src/directives/reactive_directives/form_control_directive.ts#L72). 

So if you use `[formControl]` with the components listed above, it is not possible to use their `[disabled]` property.

### Use Case

`[disabled]` controls [will not be included](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/forms/src/model/abstract_model.ts#L409) in `form.value` -  sometimes you need to render an input element as read-only but still send its value to the server.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(inputs): Add `[readonly]` property to input components" (#27955)

Issues.Title: refactor(youtube-player): simplify component internals
Issues.Body:
The `youtube-player` component was set up to use long rxjs chains everywhere which made it difficult to reason about and unnecessarily complex. This complexity would've prevented us from adding new features to it.

These changes reduce the component by ~30% while preserving its behavior and making it easier to reason about.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(youtube-player): simplify component internals" (#27951)

Issues.Title: bug(MatDatePicker): Datepicker label overflows over Icon
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

Currently updating from v. 14.2.7 to 16.2.7 (16.2.8 on stackblitz), and I noticed that the date picker isn't handling long labels correctly. Instead of showing an ellipsis, it's overflowing to behind the calendar icon. See examples below:

**Version 16.2.8 (bad):** https://stackblitz.com/edit/8enoqa?file=src%2Fexample%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.html
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/1189059/29f36b92-ab2b-4b64-8df7-da51fc008f81)

**Version 14.2.7 (good):** https://stackblitz.com/edit/c2yh3u?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.html
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/1189059/87eabada-a32d-479d-aa50-1ca91dd58523)

**Note:** Version 15.2.9 is also showing an incorrect label.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/8enoqa?file=src%2Fexample%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Wrap a datepicker in a div with a set width.
2. Set mat-form-field width to 100% of the parent width.
3. Set label to be longer than available space.
4. Observe label filling entire input, including icon space, instead of overflowing with ellipsis


### Expected Behavior

The label should fit in the allotted space and not show behind the calendar icon. 

![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/1189059/87eabada-a32d-479d-aa50-1ca91dd58523)


### Actual Behavior

The datepicker label is filling the entire input, behind the calendar icon.

![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/1189059/29f36b92-ab2b-4b64-8df7-da51fc008f81)


### Environment

- Angular: 16.2.7 / 16.2.8 (stackblitz)
- CDK/Material: 16.2.7
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Title: Swiper libraryinside Angular CDK Drag&Drop
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Hello, When you insert swiper ([https://swiperjs.com/element](https://swiperjs.com/element)) into a draggable element of the Angular CDK and try to swipe, the following error appears in the console: ``` zone.js:1681 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading '0') at DragRef._getPointerPositionInElement (drag-drop.mjs:1081:64) at DragRef._initializeDragSequence (drag-drop.mjs:864:24) at DragRef._pointerDown (drag-drop.mjs:394:22) at _ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:402:31) at Zone.runTask (zone.js:173:47) at ZoneTask.invokeTask [as invoke] (zone.js:483:34) at invokeTask (zone.js:1631:18) at globalCallback (zone.js:1662:29) at HTMLDivElement.globalZoneAwareCallback (zone.js:1695:16) at Swiper.onAny (swiper-element-bundle.mjs:173:15) ``` It seems that the error comes from this function: ``` /** * Figures out the coordinates at which an element was picked up. * @param referenceElement Element that initiated the dragging. * @param event Event that initiated the dragging. */ _getPointerPositionInElement(elementRect, referenceElement, event) { const handleElement = referenceElement === this._rootElement ? null : referenceElement; const referenceRect = handleElement ? handleElement.getBoundingClientRect() : elementRect; const point = isTouchEvent(event) ? event.targetTouches[0] : event; const scrollPosition = this._getViewportScrollPosition(); const x = point.pageX - referenceRect.left - scrollPosition.left; const y = point.pageY - referenceRect.top - scrollPosition.top; return { x: referenceRect.left - elementRect.left + x, y: referenceRect.top - elementRect.top + y, }; } ``` Thanks, greetings! ### Reproduction Git link: https://github.com/Marius-Romanus/bug-angular-swiper Steps to reproduce: 1. clone repository 2. npm install 3. ng serve 4. slide where it says "Slide 1" 5. see console ### Expected Behavior It is expected that there will be no error in the console ### Actual Behavior zone.js:1681 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading '0') ### Environment - Angular: 16.2.9 - CDK/Material: 16.2.8 - Browser(s): Chrome v118.0.5993.71 - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11 - Node: v18.17.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Swiper libraryinside Angular CDK Drag&Drop" (#27950)
